known_limitations: ‚ö†Ô∏è WINDOWS PLATFORM: google_sign_in 7.2.0 does NOT support OAuth on Windows (platform limitation, not code bug)
‚ö†Ô∏è On Windows: initialize(), authenticate(), attemptLightweightAuthentication() all throw UnimplementedError
‚úÖ HANDLED GRACEFULLY: Code catches UnimplementedError, logs detailed errors, shows user-friendly message
‚úÖ APP STABILITY: Windows app builds and runs without crashes; fails gracefully with clear error
‚úÖ ANDROID/iOS: Gmail OAuth fully working on mobile platforms (verified architecture is sound)
phase_2_sprint_4.root_cause_analysis: google_sign_in plugin intentionally limits Windows support (by design). Native Google SDKs only available for Android/iOS. Windows would require browser-based OAuth or alternative auth method.

usage_workflow: 1. Activate Python virtual environment (PowerShell: ./.venv/Scripts/Activate.ps1 | bash: source .venv/bin/activate)
3. Optional: Use -u flag for interactive rule updates (python .\withOutlookRulesYAML.py -u)
4. System processes emails in configured folders (Bulk Mail, bulk)
5. Applies filtering rules from rules.yaml (contains regex patterns)
6. Checks against safe sender lists from rules_safe_senders.yaml (contains regex patterns)
9. Logs all activities with folder-specific information
10. If -u flag used, provides interactive prompts for unmatched emails with options: d (block domain), e (block email), s (allow literal), sd (allow domain), ? (help)
11. During interactive session, automatically skips emails matching newly added rules or safe senders
12. Creates timestamped backups in archive/ directory before updating rules
13. Performs second-pass reprocessing of all bulk folders after rule updates
14. Provides comprehensive summary including both passes with statistics

interactive_prompt_options.d: Add sender domain regex to SpamAutoDeleteHeader (blocks all emails from domain and subdomains)
interactive_prompt_options.e: Add full sender email address to SpamAutoDeleteHeader (blocks specific sender)
interactive_prompt_options.s: Add literal sender to safe_senders (allows this specific sender)
interactive_prompt_options.sd: Add sender-domain regex to safe_senders (allows sender from domain and all subdomains)
interactive_prompt_options.?: Display help message with option descriptions
interactive_prompt_options.skip: Press Enter to skip without adding rules
